venue.name: Myles Standish State Forest amphitheater (behind the headquarters)

item.description:
Join award winning singer, songwriter, and educator for a concert that will get you in tune with nature! Erica’s concerts take people on a journey through the American landscape and the lives lived there. Her performance combines song, story and humor, and evokes a sense of place in listeners. Inspirational, entertaining and educational, Erica’s programs help renew the connection between people and place today.

 

 

Meet at the Amphitheater behind Headquarters. Rain date is Sunday, August 19th. Great for people of all ages.

Free.

Join us after the concert for a hike through the Pine Barrens of Myles Standish State Forest.

Presented by DCR, the Friends of Myles Standish State Forest, Luna-C Arts, and the Wildlands Trust.

About Erica Wheeler

Educator, speaker, conservation advocate, award-winning singer/songwriter Erica’s programs take people on a journey through the American landscape and the lives lived there. Her performances combine song, story and humor, and evoke a sense of place in listeners. Her workshops create opportunities for people to discover and express their sense of place.

Visit www.ericawheeler.com

Erica Wheeler performing "Muddy Waters" at the Iron Horse.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: DCR's Erica Wheeler concert at the Myles Standish amphitheater
